Name: Redgate - Deploy from Database Release (Worker Friendly)
Description:
Uses the deployment resources from the 'Redgate - Create Database Release' step to deploy the database changes using Redgate's [SQL Change Automation](http://www.red-gate.com/sca/productpage).

Requires SQL Change Automation version 3.0.2 or later.

*Version date: 2019-07-26*

This step template is worker friendly, you can pass in a package reference rather than having to reference a previous step which downloaded the package. This step requires Octopus Deploy **2019.10.0** or higher.
Author: octobob

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDeploymentResourcesPath
Parameters.Label: Export path
Parameters.HelpText:
The path the database deployment resources were exported to.

This should be the same path specified in the "Redgate - Create Database Release" step, and must be accessible to all tentacles used in database deployment steps.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseServer
Parameters.Label: Target SQL Server instance
Parameters.HelpText: The fully qualified SQL Server instance name for the target database.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseName
Parameters.Label: Target database name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the database to deploy changes to. This must be an existing database.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseUsername
Parameters.Label: Username (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: The SQL Server username used to connect to the database. If you leave this field and 'Password' blank, Windows authentication will be used to connect instead, using the account that runs the Tentacle service.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabasePassword
Parameters.Label: Password (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: You must enter a password if you entered a username.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationQueryBatchTimeout
Parameters.Label: Query batch timeout (in seconds)
Parameters.HelpText: The execution timeout, in seconds, for each batch of queries in the update script. The default value is 30 seconds. A value of zero indicates no execution timeout.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationSkipPostUpdateSchemaCheck
Parameters.Label: Skip post update schema check
Parameters.HelpText: Don't check that the target database has the correct schema after the update has run.

Parameters.Name: SpecificModuleVersion
Parameters.Label: SQL Change Automation version (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: If you wish to use a specific version of SQL Change Automation rather than the latest, enter the version number here.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationPackageName
Parameters.Label: Package
Parameters.HelpText: The package which is being deployed

Parameters.Name: DLMModuleInstallLocation
Parameters.Label: SQL Change Automation Install Location (optional)
Parameters.HelpText:
The SQL Change Automation cmdlets will be downloaded from the [PowerShell gallery](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/SqlChangeAutomation).  Please specify the folder folder where those packages will be saved to.  It can be relative or absolute.


If this is empty it will default `$Home\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules` which is the [recommended location](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/developer/module/installing-a-powershell-module?view=powershell-7#where-to-install-modules) from Microsoft.
